quotes: where he graduated from the Institute of Oriental Studies in 1953
received a candidate degree in economics from the M.V. Lomonosov Moscow State University in 1956
He joined the Communist Party of the Soviet Union in 1959
From 1962 to 1970 Primakov worked for Pravda, the party’s daily newspaper
In 1970 Primakov was named deputy director of the Institute of World Economy and International Relations (IMEMO)
in 1977 he was appointed director of the Institute of Oriental Studies
He became director of IMEMO in 1985
becoming a candidate member of the Politburo, the policy-making body of the party, in 1989
losing both his son and his first wife to heart disease in the 1980s
in the fall of 1991 he was made first deputy to the director of the Committee for State Security (KGB)
Boris Yeltsin appointed him foreign minister in 1996
In September 1998 Yeltsin appointed Primakov prime minister
Born: October 29, 1929, Kiev, Ukraine, U.S.S.R.
Died: June 26, 2015, Moscow, Russia (aged 85)
